newsitem.title: INDIA: Local buying spurs India shares to higher close.
newsitem.headline: Local buying spurs India shares to higher close.

text.p: ** Expectations high ahead of month-end 1997/98 budget
** National bourse 50-stock index ends 11.30 pts, or 1.15
** Delhi share index gains 9.88 pts to 749.16, Calcutta
3.84 pts to 454.94 and Madras 47.01 pts to 3,382.89
Indian shares notched smart gains on Tuesday as renewed local operator buying ahead of the federal budget helped pivotals end higher, dealers said.
Participants said speculation that the 1997/98 budget due on February 28 will contain market friendly measures prompted buying.
"With growing expectations about the budget, more players are entering the market," said chief dealer Ketan Jhaveri at brokerage Kotak Securities.
Some funds were keen buyers in cement stocks in anticipation of incentives likely to be given to the industry, traders said.

Cement maker ACC jumped 78.0 rupees, or 5.63 percent, to 1,462.25 in volumes of 129,786. Gujarat Ambuja Cement which last week announced a 20 percent rise in net profit for the first half ending December 1996 rose 9.0 rupees, or 3.68 percent, to 253.0 with 435,159 shares traded.
"The market has shown a steady rise today. It is more due to operators building up positions ahead of the budget," said Ravi Chadha, institutional dealer at brokers Motilal Oswal.
Kotak's Jhaveri said, "The nominal arbitrage opportunities between Bombay bourses indicates that operators are taking delivery based positions."
"This is pre-budget euphoria that we are seeing. A short-term rally is likely to prompt fence-sitters to build up fresh positions," said a dealer at a foreign brokerage.
"Foreign funds however, are not aggressive buyers," he said.
In the list of pivotal stocks, SBI gained 11.50 rupees to 282.75, TELCO 13.20 to 333.0, L&T 7.0 to 247.50, ITC 8.0 to 409.0 and Reliance 4.50 to 278.0.
"The market has turned volatile and is likely to show two-way movements until the budget," said Suresh Aggarwal of Delhi brokers Jai Mata Securities.
